name: consumable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
finance & economics bought regularly because of being quickly used and needing to be replaced often: Consumable items such as groceries and petrol should be paid for with cash or a debit card.
possible to eat, drink, or use up completely: Some of the items in the shop are consumable within the museum.

Consumables are goods, especially food or services, that people buy regularly because they are quickly used and need to be replaced often: At this hospital we use up bandages, disposable gloves, and other consumables very quickly.
